entry.title: Beach day
entry.summary: Beach day The O'Brien family are spending the day at the beach. The want to find the perfect umbrella. The umbrellas are numbered 1-10. First, they need to be sure the umbrella is free. It is free, if both sunbeds don’t have towels on them.
entry.content:
Beach day

 

The O'Brien family are spending the day at the beach. The want to find the perfect umbrella. The umbrellas are numbered 1-10.

First, they need to be sure the umbrella is free. It is free, if both sunbeds don’t have towels on them.

Second, they don’t want to be directly next to where people walk. They can check for footprints in the sand.

Third, they don’t want to be directly next to any wet sand. They can tell if the sand is wet by itsdarker colour.

Fourth, they don’t want to sit where they will hear music coming from the people next to them.

The range of the music is marked on in the pictures with music notes in the squar

Finally, they want to have some space to play in the sand, at least 2 squares should be enough space.

 

 

 

 

 

QUESTION

Question: Which umbrella is the best one for the O’Brien family to sit under?

Teachers

entry.title: Meet the team
entry.summary: Joe Bloggs: Beaver The world’s most industrious philanthropic beaver, has dedicated his life to improving the lives of fellow woodland creatures. Joan Bloggs: The enigmatic beaver detective, spends his days solving mysteries in the heart of the forest. Joey Bloggs: Beaver spends his days in…
entry.content:
Joe Bloggs: Beaver

The world’s most industrious philanthropic beaver, has dedicated his life to improving the lives of fellow woodland creatures. 

Joan Bloggs:

The enigmatic beaver detective, spends his days solving mysteries in the heart of the forest. 

Joey Bloggs: Beaver

spends his days in his cozy workshop, surrounded by gears, pulleys, and half-finished contraptions. 

Jenkins Bloggs: Beaver

Patrols the serene forest pond, ensuring that all creatures swim safely. She hosts synchronized swimming shows.

Jennifer Bloggs: Beaver

Spends her days deciphering ancient tree rings and uncovering forgotten beaver legends. She claims that the oldest oak in the forest once hosted a beaver disco.

Jenny Bloggs: Beaver

Soars above the treetops in her custom-built wooden airplane, leaving fluffy cumulus clouds in her wake.

Joseph Bloggs: Beaver

Composes haikus while floating downstream. His favorite subjects? Sun-dappled water, lily pads, and the elusive moonbeam fish.

Juniper Bloggs: Beaver

Wields her trusty chainsaw, felling trees with precision. But she’s no ordinary lumberjack—she plants two saplings for every tree she cuts.

Julius Bloggs: Beaver

He emerges from the murky depths when the clock strikes midnight, leaving behind ripples that echo like ghostly whispers.
